What one fool can do, another can. 
 Ancient Simian Proverb

A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step. 
 Chinese Proverb

Even monkeys fall from trees. 
 Japanese Proverb

The wise learn many things from their enemies. 
 Ancient Greek Proverb

Fall seven times, stand up eight. 
 Japanese Proverb

He who asks is a fool for five minutes, but he who does not ask remains a fool forever. 
 Chinese Proverb

A wise man makes his own decisions; an ignorant man follows public opinion. 
 Chinese Proverb

The nail that sticks out gets hammered down. 
 Japanese Proverb

Do not judge by appearances; a rich heart may be under a poor coat. 
 Scottish Proverb

No snowflake in an avalanche ever feels responsible. 
 Voltaire

A cat has nine lives, but needs only one. 
 English Proverb

The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now. 
 Chinese Proverb

When the character of a man is not clear to you, look at his friends. 
 Japanese Proverb

One who smiles rather than rages is always the stronger. 
 Japanese Wisdom

A man who chases two rabbits catches neither. 
 Chinese Proverb

If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together. 
 African Proverb

The frog in the well knows nothing of the great ocean. 
 Japanese Proverb

A gem is not polished without rubbing, nor a man perfected without trials. 
 Chinese Proverb

Better to light a candle than to curse the darkness. 
 Chinese Proverb

When the wind of change blows, some build walls while others build windmills. 
 Chinese Proverb

Three men make a tiger. 
 Chinese Proverb

To know the road ahead, ask those coming back. 
 Chinese Proverb

An invisible thread connects those who are destined to meet. 
 Chinese Proverb

The tongue like a sharp knife... Kills without drawing blood. 
 Buddha

A wise man adapts himself to circumstances, as water shapes itself to the vessel that contains it. 
 Chinese Proverb

One beam, no matter how big, cannot support an entire house on its own. 
 Chinese Proverb

Even if you are on the right track, you’ll get run over if you just sit there. 
 Will Rogers

If you want happiness for an hour, take a nap. 
 If you want happiness for a lifetime, help somebody. 
 Chinese Proverb

Just as tall trees are known by their shadows, 
 so are good men known by their enemies. 
 Chinese Proverb

A wise man can learn more from a foolish question 
 than a fool can learn from a wise answer. 
 Bruce Lee

Be water, my friend. Empty your mind, be formless, shapeless — like water. 
 You put water into a cup, it becomes the cup. 
 You put water into a bottle, it becomes the bottle. 
  You put it in a teapot, it becomes the teapot. 
  Now, water can flow or it can crash. Be water, my friend. 
 Bruce Lee

Water is the softest thing, 
 yet it can penetrate mountains and earth. 
 This shows clearly the principle 
 of softness overcoming hardness. 
 Bruce Lee

Nihil in terra sine causa fit. 
 The Bible

Everything connects to everything else. 
 Leonardo da Vinci

The law of causation... is a relic of a bygone age, surviving, like the monarchy, only because it is erroneously supposed to do no harm. 
 Bertrand Russell

The confusions which occupy us arise when language is like an engine idling, not when it is doing work. 
 Ludwig Wittgenstein

There is nothing so absurd that it cannot be
 believed as truth if repeated often enough. 
 William James

A dream you dream alone is only a dream. A dream you dream together is reality. 
 John Lennon

I move, therefore I am. 
 Haruki Murakami

The only way to deal with the void is to become it. 
 Haruki Murakami

In the beginning was the act. 
 Goethe's Faust

Not hearing is not as good as hearing, hearing is not
 as good as seeing, seeing is not as good as knowing,
 knowing is not as good as acting; 
true learning continues until it is put into action. 
 Confucius

A city... is actually a sequence of spaces enclosed and defined by buildings. 
 I. M. Pei

If I have seen further it is by standing on the shoulders of Giants. 
 Isaac Newton

The whole is more than the sum of its parts. 
 Aristotle

Man can do what he wills but he cannot will what he wills. 
 Arthur Schopenhauer

An unmistakable difference exists between spatial and temporal concepts. 
 Henrik Lorentz

Time is an abstraction at which we arrive by means of changing of things. 
 Ernst Mach

Space and duration are one. 
 Edgar Allan Poe

Energy is liberated matter, matter is energy waiting to happen. 
 Bill Bryson

Not only is the Universe stranger than we think, it is stranger than we can think. 
 Werner Heisenberg

It doesn't matter how beautiful your theory is,
 it doesn't matter how smart you are.
 If it doesn't agree with experiment, it's wrong. 
 Richard Feynman

Physicists have come to realize that mathematics,
 when used with sufficient care,
 is a proven pathway to truth. 
 Brian Greene

If the universe is an artificial simulation then 
 the mathematics is its code and 
 a physicist is a programmer. 
 Shubham Sanap

I believe that a scientist looking at nonscientific problems 
 is just as dumb as the next guy. 
 Richard Feynman

It's tough for magic to argue with physics, most of the time. 
 Jim Butcher

Primitive life is very common
 and intelligent life is fairly rare.
 Some would say it has yet to occur on Earth. 
 Stephen Hawking

Deep down, nature is inherently peaceful, calm and beautiful.
 The universe as a whole is perfect.
 The chaos is on the surface.
Amit Ray

That deep emotional conviction of the presence of a superior reasoning power,
 which is revealed in the incomprehensible universe,
 forms my idea of God.
 Albert Einstein
